metadata.name: AWS STS GetSessionToken Misuse
metadata.comment: Identifies the suspicious use of GetSessionToken. Tokens could be created and used by attackers to move laterally and escalate privileges.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM datastore_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(metadata.product.name) = lower('sts.amazonaws.com') AND lower(api.operation) = lower('getsessiontoken') AND lower(actor.user.type) = lower('iamuser'))

output.summary: Identifies the suspicious use of GetSessionToken. Tokens could be created and used by attackers to move laterally and escalate privileges.

metadata.objective: False positive: GetSessionToken may be done by a system or network administrator. Verify whether the user identity, user agent, and/or hostname should be making changes in your environment. GetSessionToken from unfamiliar users or hosts should be investigated. If known behavior is causing false positives, it can be exempted from the rule. References: https://github.com/elastic/detection-rules/pull/1213, https://docs.aws.amazon.com/STS/latest/APIReference/API_GetSessionToken.html
